Articles.Content:
Can Kerbals from one ship get on another ship if there is room?

and can a Kerbal collect science from a probe that has an unmanned control center.

I have a probe which has very good science if I can bring the data home, I loss a lot of % by transmitting. So I plan to send a team up.
Yes they can, but they must do so by EVA.

Yes they can, but they must do so by EVA.

perfect..thanks

1. Yes, they can transfer from one ship to another by EVA'ing (Extra Vehicular Activity - AKA flying around in a spacesuit)

2. Kerbals can collect science from scientific instruments, as long as they are close enough. This science can then be deposited in a command pod or a few modded "science hard drive" parts.

3. The science cannot be collected if it has already be transmitted. If it hasn't, you can collect it.
In stock, no. But there's a mod that lets you do that. I think it's called Crew Manifest or something.

In stock, no. But there's a mod that lets you do that. I think it's called Crew Manifest or something.

This is true if you don't want to (or can't) EVA them.

"can a Kerbal collect science from a probe that has an unmanned control center?"

It is a 0.23 feature, so yes, you can.
